pageTitle: Sunday, January 1, 2012 Pittsburgh Steelers - Cleveland Browns Box Scores, Game Results & Summary - USATODAY.com
TableContextTimeStampAfterTable: {73799=Pittsburgh, instead, will be relegated to the fifth seed in the AFC and a trip to Denver in the wild-card round next Sunday at 4:30 p.m. (et)., 75384=Redman concluded the quick six-play, 43-yard drive by scampering in from seven yards out to give the Steelers their first lead of the game, 13-6, with 5:27 remaining in the third quarter., 76126=Redman's second miscue came with 5:49 left as he lost the football while trying to fight for extra yardage along the right sideline. Joe Haden pounced on the loose ball at Cleveland's 39., 73954=After being held out of last Saturday's 27-0 rout of St. Louis, Ben Roethlisberger played the full 60 minutes on Sunday despite a high ankle sprain he suffered during Pittsburgh's 14-3 win over Cleveland on December 8., 76433=The Steelers regained possession at their own 11 with 4:59 to go. Pittsburgh ran 3:13 off the clock before punting the ball back to Cleveland.}
